items.title: SpaceX offers Starlink kits for quake relief in Myanmar, Thailand
items.summary:
- SpaceX announced it will provide Starlink kits for communication assistance after an earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand.
- The provision of kits is contingent upon receiving necessary governmental approvals.
- The impact of the earthquake is currently being assessed as relief efforts are ongoing.

items.title: Down but not out
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's startup funding has decreased for the third consecutive year in 2024.
- The highest funding deals this week did not include startups from Southeast Asia.
- Notable recent events include the eFishery scandal and ongoing political uncertainty affecting the region's tech landscape.
- Apna Mart in India raised $25 million, while others like Brevel and Nayla Finance also secured funding.
- Duab.ai and Shipway were acquired for undisclosed sums.

items.title: SoftBank reportedly plans $1t AI parks in the US
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. is considering investing over US$1 trillion in AI industrial parks across the US.
- Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son is expected to outline his vision during a visit to the US, focusing on using AI-equipped robots to address labor shortages.
- In January, SoftBank announced a US$100 billion partnership with OpenAI and Oracle to develop AI infrastructure, aiming to increase funding to US$500 billion for data centers and campuses.
- Abu Dhabi’s state investor MGX will support the initiative, with the first computing system planned for construction in Texas.
- SoftBank has not confirmed the US$1 trillion figure or provided details on the timeline or scope of the proposed parks.

items.title: India court rules Google’s billing policy anti-competitive
Charting Asia’s M&As: When do startups usually make an exit?
Huawei execs accused of approving bribes to EU lawmakers
items.summary:
- Belgian authorities accused Huawei executives of approving alleged bribes to EU lawmakers in 2021.
- A Huawei lobbyist reportedly offered €15,000 to a Member of the European Parliament and €1,500 to co-signers promoting Huawei's interests.
- Four individuals arrested for corruption; a fifth was released on bail facing money laundering charges.
- The case has heightened scrutiny of EU corruption after the Qatargate scandal.
- MEP Fulvio Martusciello is accused of accepting €15,000, which he denies; his assistant is under house arrest.
- Huawei claims a zero-tolerance policy for corruption and is cooperating with authorities.
- The European Commission and Parliament have not issued comments regarding the allegations.
- Concerns about Huawei's connections with the EU continue, with some member states limiting its equipment in critical infrastructure.

items.title: Swiggy, Zomato may pay 2% for gig workers’ earnings for pension
US SEC drops investigation into Crypto.com without charges
items.summary:
- The US SEC has completed its investigation into Crypto.com without enforcement actions as of March 27.
- The probe began after a Wells notice was issued to Crypto.com in October, indicating potential charges.
- Crypto.com previously sued the SEC for overreach but withdrew the lawsuit in December.
- The SEC has not commented publicly on its decision on the investigation.
- This case follows other dropped investigations into crypto firms like Kraken, Coinbase, and Ripple.
- The SEC is updating its guidance on the crypto sector and has formed a new task force under incoming Chair Paul Atkins.
- Crypto.com continues to operate without legal challenges from the SEC, serving over 140 million customers.

items.title: 50 rising greentech startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists cleantech startups in Asia that have recently closed funding rounds.
- The list is continually updated and includes companies up to series E stage.
- Each entry contains key details about the respective funding round.

items.title: Musk’s xAI buys X social media platform for $33b
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s xAI has acquired social media platform X in an all-stock transaction.
- The deal values xAI at US$80 billion and X at US$33 billion, including US$12 billion in debt.
- This acquisition follows xAI’s rapid growth since its founding two years ago.
- The companies plan to combine resources, such as data, computational power, and talent, to enhance user experiences and expand global impact.
- No additional details about operational changes or leadership structure post-acquisition have been disclosed.

items.title: BYD to invest $10b in its first Indian EV factory
items.summary:
- BYD plans to invest US$10 billion in a facility near Hyderabad, Telangana.
- The new plant will manufacture battery systems and electric vehicles, targeting an annual production capacity of 600,000 EVs by 2032.
- Includes a battery unit with a 20 GWh annual capacity, marking BYD's first factory in India.
- This investment is part of India's growing attraction for global EV manufacturers like Tesla.
- India recorded over 1.9 million EV registrations in 2024, supported by policy changes such as reduced import duties.

items.title: EU tariffs cut Chinese EV market share to 6.9% in Europe
items.summary:
- Chinese automakers' share of the European EV market dropped to 6.9% in February 2025, the lowest since February 2023.
- This decline is attributed to EU tariffs on Chinese-made EVs, impacting their market expansion.
- Overall European EV sales grew by 26%, with established brands like Volkswagen benefiting significantly.
- BYD saw its registrations almost double to 4,436 units, while MG faced a sharp decline due to tariffs up to 45.3%.
- Xpeng and Leapmotor reported growth; Xpeng's registrations surged 259% year-on-year.
- Total Chinese EV registrations decreased by 3.2% to 9,837 units amid stringent tariffs.

items.title: Starlink may face premium pricing in India
items.summary:
- Starlink may implement premium pricing in India due to limited capacity, per a Jefferies report.
- Current infrastructure supports 180,000 users at 100 Mbps; expected to grow to 5.7 million by 2030.
- Projected pricing could be 2-3 times higher than traditional providers, similar to pricing in the US, Kenya, and Nigeria.
- Starlink is facing capacity constraints and awaiting key approvals like the GMPCS license.
- Telecom Regulatory Authority of India is considering a shorter spectrum allocation of five years.
- Partnerships with Jio and Airtel may assist distribution amidst limited competition from established telecom players.
- India is strategically important for Starlink, especially following exclusion from China and Russia, but its impact on major telecom operators is likely minimal.

items.title: US, China compete for leadership in humanoid robotics
items.summary:
- The US and China are engaged in a competitive race to develop humanoid robotics, focusing on innovative technologies.
- Key players from both countries are investing heavily in research and development to advance their capabilities.
- The outcomes of this rivalry could significantly influence global technology leadership and economic power dynamics.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s health startups?
Chinese top chipmakers struggle with rising competition
items.summary:
- Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) reported a 27% increase in revenue for 2024 to US$8 billion.
- Net profit for SMIC fell 45.4% year-on-year to US$493 million due to challenges in the legacy chip market and US export restrictions.
- Hua Hong Semiconductor's revenue decreased by 12.3% to US$2 billion, and net profit dropped 79.2% to US$58 million, leading to a decline in its share price.
- Both companies are facing intense competition in China's semiconductor market with high-end chip production restrictions.
- In contrast, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) posted a 40% increase in net profit to US$35 billion.

items.title: The hidden alliances between Southeast Asia’s VCs, uncovered
items.summary:
- VCs in Southeast Asia often co-invest, revealing hidden alliances among firms.
- Some firms invest together consistently, indicating deeper relationships, while others avoid collaboration.
- A visual representation shows relationships among VCs based on deal data from the past two years.
- This information may assist startup founders in understanding fundraising dynamics.
- A table lists the top 20 VCs by the number of co-investors and collaborations.

items.title: AI agriculture firm Cropin partners with Walmart
items.summary:
- Cropin collaborates with Walmart to enhance agricultural technology.
- The partnership aims to leverage AI for better crop management and yield.
- Focus on improving supply chain efficiency and farmer connectivity.

items.title: AWS denies reports of 10% staff cuts in China
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) denies claims of layoffs of approximately 10% in Greater China operations.
- AWS describes local media reports as "seriously inaccurate" and emphasizes commitment to hiring.
- Reports suggested non-renewal of contracts unless employees achieved top performance ratings, along with a hiring freeze in non-sales roles.
- AWS has not clarified details on performance evaluations or contract processes in China.

items.title: What the IDX plunge means for tech
items.summary:
- The Indonesia Stock Exchange’s composite index dropped by 6% on March 18, leading to a temporary trading halt.
- The rupiah fell to its lowest value since the 1998 Asian Financial Crisis, signaling potential economic instability.
- Experts are divided on the long-term impact on Indonesian tech startups, with some viewing challenges as short-term corrections and others noting deeper effects.
- IDX-listed tech firms like GoTo and Bukalapak remain stable despite broader market concerns, but investor confidence is wavering.
- The weakening rupiah could affect venture capital valuations and returns but may offer investors better opportunities.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Southeast Asia’s startups
items.summary:
- The article lists the most active investors in Southeast Asia's startups over the past 12 months.
- It highlights firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this time.
- The list is based on the number of deals done by each firm and is a work in progress for accuracy improvements.

items.title: Huawei rebounds, hits $118b revenue with global expansion
items.summary:
- Huawei reports expected revenues of 860 billion yuan (US$118 billion) for 2024, approaching 2020 levels.
- The company has diversified its operations into smart-driving technology, 5G infrastructure, and energy storage to mitigate US sanctions.
- Partnerships with state-owned automakers have resulted in tripled sales for Aito-branded EVs in the past year.
- Projected smartphone shipments for 2024 are over 45 million units, reflecting a 25% increase year-on-year despite challenges in chip production.
- Huawei continues to expand its global presence despite difficulties in Western markets.

items.title: S Korea keeps DeepSeek ban over data concerns
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- South Korea has not set a timeline for resuming the DeepSeek AI app from China due to data management concerns.
- The app's suspension began on Feb. 15, 2025, initiated by the Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC).
- Violations of personal information protection laws led to the suspension, which will continue until compliance is achieved.
- DeepSeek aims to comply with South Korea's Personal Information Protection Act, acknowledging previous shortcomings.

items.title: TSMC-linked Gallant Micro reports record $30m AI chip orders
items.summary:
- Gallant Micro reported record orders of NT$1 billion (US$30.21 million) for 2025.
- Orders are driven by strong demand for advanced chip packaging technology, notably CoWoS technology for AI chips.
- Order visibility extends through the first quarter of 2026, with optimism for continued growth due to the AI boom.
- The company plans to establish a US office and production line, with the first line expected in two years.

items.title: Indian fintech startup axiTrust nets $2.6m seed funding
items.author: Aditya Tulsian, Mukund Daga, Rajeev Chari
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based fintech startup axiTrust Surety raised ₹22 crore (US$2.57 million) in seed funding led by General Catalyst.
- Other participants in the round included Veltis Capital, Good Capital, and AngelList.
- axiTrust, founded in 2024, offers micro surety bonds for MSMEs as a collateral-free alternative to traditional bank guarantees.
- The company plans to integrate its platform with MSME systems for enhanced insights and automation.
- The startup, currently an eight-member team, aims to use the funds for hiring, app development, and marketing.
- General Catalyst has a history of backing successful fintech companies like CRED and Uni Cards.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: EV players Scorpio Electric, Zypp slash jobs
items.summary:
• Tech in Asia updates layoff tracker regularly, focusing on job cuts in the tech industry.
• Economic uncertainty and bleak fundraising outlook continue to lead to layoffs across Asia.
• Companies like Oddle, Zypp Electric, and Scorpio Electric have made recent staffing cuts due to these pressures.
• Zypp Electric aims for an IPO by late 2026, while Scorpio Electric plans to deliver its first e-bike amid layoffs.
• Total funding in Southeast Asia, India, and China fell significantly in 2024, influencing job cuts.

items.title: 20 largest exits in SEA
Taiwan probes China’s largest chip firm for illegal hiring
items.summary:
- Taiwan is investigating China’s largest semiconductor firm for allegedly hiring illegally.
- The probe raises concerns over compliance with Taiwan’s laws regarding employment practices.
- This investigation could impact China's semiconductor industry amid ongoing tensions with Taiwan.

items.title: Indian investment tech startup Smallcase bags $50m series D
items.author: Vasanth Kamath, Rohan Gupta, Anugrah Shrivastava
items.summary:
- Smallcase has secured US$50 million in series D funding led by Elev8 Venture Partners.
- Other investors include State Street Global Advisors, Niveshaay AIF, Faering Capital, and Arkam Ventures.
- The funds will be used to diversify investment products and enhance technology and analytics capabilities.
- Smallcase, founded in 2016, offers curated baskets of stocks called 'smallcases' for investment through demat accounts.

items.title: Alibaba’s Cainiao opens Vietnam’s largest AI sorting center
items.summary:
- Cainiao has opened the largest automated sorting center in southern Vietnam.
- Developed for a leading courier company to enhance the country's growing ecommerce sector.
- The facility features advanced technologies like automated parcel separation and sorting robots, achieving over 99% accuracy.
- Completed in 100 days despite shipping delays caused by typhoons.

items.title: Indian fintech firm OneStack nets $2m series A
items.author: Amit Kapoor, Vishal Gupta
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based fintech startup OneStack raised $2 million in series A funding led by Pentathlon Ventures.
- Previous funding included $1.87 million from investors like AngeBay and Stride Ventures.
- Founded in 2019, OneStack digitizes services for cooperative banks and credit societies.
- Offers core banking solutions including mobile banking, UPI, and BBPS.
- Plans to expand in southern and eastern India, onboarding 200 more banks and aiming for a 20% market share nationwide.

items.title: EU plans new moves to boost semiconductor industry
items.author: Henna Virkkunen
items.summary:
- The EU is considering new measures to support its semiconductor industry.
- Discussions about a potential “Chips Act 2.0” are ongoing after the original €43 billion Chips Act launched in 2023.
- The initial Chips Act aimed to prevent decline in Europe’s semiconductor sector but did not fully meet its goals.
- New initiatives will focus on advanced chipmaking, packaging, strengthening supply chains, and utilizing Europe’s strengths in chip equipment manufacturing.

items.title: Taiwan releases first startup ecosystem report
items.summary:
- Taiwan has published its first startup ecosystem report.
- The report aims to provide insights into the state and growth of startups in the region.
- It includes various metrics and analyses to assess the ecosystem's performance and potential.

items.title: PUBG maker Krafton acquires Indian gaming studio
AI chip demand drove Taiwan’s economic growth in Feb 2025
Israeli AI startup PhaseV boosts clinical trial success
Mapping India’s ecommerce standouts
items.summary:
- This landscape map provides an overview of key players in India’s ecommerce sector.
- Highlights active backers and investment trends in the ecommerce vertical.
- For more landscape reports, visit [Tech in Asia](https://www.techinasia.com/category/landscape-reports).

items.title: Taiwan approves investment plans from local Google, Amazon units
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) has approved investment plans from Google, Amazon, and TSMC.
- Google Engineering UK Holdings to invest NT$7 billion (US$211.3 million) in research for mobile and wearable technology in Taiwan.
- Amazon's A100 Row Inc. is authorized for NT$2.59 billion (US$87.2 million) investment in AWS Taiwan for personnel costs and equipment maintenance.
- TSMC's US$10 billion outbound investment to TSMC Global in the British Virgin Islands also approved by MOEA.

items.title: Ubisoft creates $4.3b unit to oversee key franchises
items.summary:
- Ubisoft Entertainment SA has launched a new subsidiary to manage key franchises like Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six.
- The subsidiary is valued at roughly €4 billion (US$4.3 billion), with Tencent acquiring a 25% stake for €1.16 billion (US$1.25 billion).
- The deal aims to reduce Ubisoft’s debt and support other franchises, expected to close by the end of 2025.

items.title: Meta’s Asia-Pacific head Dan Neary steps down after 12 years
items.summary:
- Dan Neary is leaving Meta after 12 years as the Asia-Pacific head.
- His departure is for personal reasons, and he will assist in the transition process over the next several months.
- Neary joined Meta (formerly Facebook) in 2013 and played a key role in expanding its market presence in Australia, Greater China, and Southeast Asia.
- Significant growth in user bases and ad revenue occurred during his tenure.
- Prior to Meta, Neary worked at Skype and eBay.
- His departure aligns with Meta's increased focus on AI developments.

items.title: UK regulator fines OnlyFans $1.4m for age verification failures
items.summary:
- Ofcom fined Fenix International Limited £1.05 million (US$1.4 million) for age verification inaccuracies.
- The company misreported its “challenger age” threshold as 23 years, when it was actually set at 20.
- OnlyFans adjusted its age threshold to 23 years in January 2025, then lowered it to 21.
- Ofcom’s enforcement director stated the importance of accurate information for regulatory oversight.
- OnlyFans confirmed the investigation's resolution and emphasized compliance commitment.

items.title: Indian gov’t to launch new taxi service to rival Ola, Uber
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Indian government is launching a new taxi service named “Sahkar Taxi” to compete with Ola and Uber.
- The service will include two-wheeler taxis, auto-rickshaws, and four-wheeler taxis.
- Union Home Minister Amit Shah emphasized that the service allows drivers to earn directly without sharing profits with larger companies.
- Sahkar Taxi is expected to roll out nationwide in the coming months.
- The initiative is inspired by previous models like West Bengal’s “Yatri Sathi” program.

items.title: Unlocking SEA’s investment potential
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's digital economy's gross merchandise value (GMV) reached US$263 billion in 2024, growing 15% year-on-year.
- Key sectors driving economic growth include ecommerce, fintech, AI, and cleantech, with substantial investments expected to continue.
- The region's ecommerce sector showed a 15% growth, significantly aided by video commerce.
- Fintech innovation is growing with the popularity of digital payments and lending platforms like Funding Societies and Amartha.
- Over US$30 billion was invested in AI infrastructure in the first half of 2024, highlighting the sector's growth potential.
- Southeast Asia's net zero ambition faces challenges but also presents opportunities in renewable energy and sustainable technologies.
- Investors should focus on adaptable strategies amid shifting conditions, sustainable growth, and diverse regulatory environments.

items.title: Nvidia backs CoreWeave IPO at $40 per share, source says
items.summary:
- Nvidia is backing CoreWeave’s IPO with a US$250 million order at US$40 per share.
- The IPO was initially priced between US$47 and US$55 per share, but CoreWeave will not adjust or refile.
- Nvidia owns about 6% of CoreWeave; both Nvidia and CoreWeave declined to comment on the matter.
- The IPO occurs during a market slowdown, influenced by inflation, interest rates, and global trade tensions.

items.title: India’s Jio Financial invests $117m in its lending arm
items.summary:
- Jio Financial Services invests ₹1,000.24 crore (US$117 million) into Jio Finance Limited (JFL).
- The investment was announced on March 27, consisting of 1.73 crore equity shares priced at ₹10 (US$0.12) each.
- JFL, formerly Reliance Retail Ventures Limited, changed its name in August 2023 and provides various financial services, including home loans.

items.title: Supercharge your growth in 4 hours
items.summary:
- AMPED, a new event series, offers a four-hour experience with local tips and hands-on activities.
- The first event is scheduled for June 11, 2025, in Malaysia, focusing on scaling strategies, practical skills, and networking.
- Malaysia is poised as a tech hub in Southeast Asia, providing opportunities for startups and investors.
- Early bird tickets are available for US$40 until April 11, 2025, or until sold out.

items.title: Chinese cloud market to grow 15% in 2025
items.author: Rachel Brindley
items.summary:
- Cloud infrastructure spending in mainland China is projected to grow by 15% in 2025, reaching US$46 billion according to a report by Canalys.
- There was a 13% increase in 2024, driven by the adoption of AI technologies.
- Launch of AI foundation models like DeepSeek’s R1 has promoted enterprise AI adoption, changing performance and cost benchmarks.
- Major cloud providers including Alibaba, Huawei, and Tencent are expanding investments in computing resources and AI infrastructure.
- Alibaba, holding a 36% market share in Q4 2024, plans to invest 380 billion yuan (US$52.4 billion) over the next three years.

items.title: WhatsApp gains EU court support in privacy fine dispute
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- WhatsApp received support from the EU court regarding a privacy fine dispute.
- The ruling could have implications for data protection regulations.
- The case highlighted tensions between tech companies and EU privacy laws.

items.title: Google adds AI tools to Maps, Search, Hotels for travel
items.summary:
- Google enhances travel planning with updates to Maps, Search, and Hotels.
- New Google Maps feature lets users identify and save locations from screenshots using Gemini AI, available to iOS users in the US this week.
- Google Search now provides itinerary-building tools for customized trip plans, with options to save to Google Maps or export to Google Docs or Gmail.
- AI Overviews in Google Lens now support six additional languages, including Hindi and Spanish.
- Global rollout of price drop alerts for hotels allows users to monitor prices and receive email notifications on changes.

items.title: IBM spinoff Kyndryl falls 11% on fraud allegations
items.summary:
- Shares of Kyndryl dropped over 11% on Mar. 27 due to allegations from short-seller Gotham City regarding financial manipulation.
- Report claims the company altered metrics to appear profitable despite ongoing losses and cash burn.
- Kyndryl’s revenue has declined year over year, with more accurate calculations showing negative cash flow.
- Rising costs related to IBM could increase by $1 to $2 billion in the coming years.
- Allegations include accounting and disclosure irregularities concerning payments to IBM from 2019 to 2023.
- Kyndryl, spun off from IBM, has not responded to these allegations.
